result.execSummary:
The defendant Josue Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years, including family members.
No contact with the victim, Court will allow contact with the victims mother as long as she approves.
No social media accounts.  Defendant may maintain an email account.
No employment where children under the age of 16 years are present.

Register and comply with the sex offender registry.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Any electronic devices must be turned over to agent for inspection upon demand.
Attend anger management classes. Attend cognitive thinking class.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previusly submitted, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting and child sex offender working with children.
$528.00 to Madeline R.  To be paid first, before costs.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josue Moreno

records.addlTxt: Defendant's sec. 973.195 petition for sentence adjustment was returned because he is serving confinement time in this case for a Class B felony.  Inmates serving confinement time for a Class B felony are not eligible to petition for a sentence adjustment.
Received & Filed, SENTENCING Original Transcript (59 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 15, 2014 by STEPHANIE SHOATE.
Converted at request of Court Reporter Stephanie Shoate.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Victim impact statement recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Ivelisse Q. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26200015 in court 1x on 8/4/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 8/6/14 for Ivelisse Q. for 1 appearance on 8/4/14.

Defendant Josue Moreno in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Josue Moreno in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Parties have reached a resolution. Plea hearing proceeded. 
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Court ordered a presentence investigation with a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Josue Moreno in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Josue Moreno in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. State has recently made an additional offer to the defense. Defense counsel requests additional time to review the offer with the defendant and anticipates a resolution in this matter. Case passed to 1:30 p.m.

Notice Of Intent To Offer Audiovisual Recording Of Child's Statement received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Case remains scheduled for jury trial in Branch 25 on 08-04-2014.

Court will not forfeit bail previously posted; therefore an additional $6,500 to be posted as to this case.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court advises defendant that the No Contact Order remains in effect.

As an additional condition of bail:
No weapons
No drugs without a valid prescription.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Josue Moreno in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant arrived late to court.
State informs Court they are withdrawing the plea offer as defendant may be charged with a new offense.
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Court will amend bail.

Court orders case remain scheduled for trial in Branch 25.
Clerk:  jms

Per Court, case recalled on the record in the afternoon. No appearances by the parties. Defense counsel appeared for court at 11:45 a.m. this morning, defendant was present in court for the entire morning. Case remains scheduled for projected plea date on 7/30/14 at 8:30 a.m. Jury trial remains scheduled for 8/04/14 at 9:00 a.m. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Josue Moreno in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Due to defense counsel's late arrival to court, this matter heard off the record as the Court released the reporter for the morning. Parties believe this matter will resolve prior to jury trial. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/04/14. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Plea Hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Josue Moreno in court. Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel has recently received discovery and has not yet received an offer from the State. Court ordered this matter set for final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties will inform the court if a resolution is reached prior to final pretrial date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
14RM023147  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-29-2014

Defendant Josue Moreno in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Josue Moreno in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.M.M. (DOB:  08/15/2008).

Defendant Josue Moreno in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Josue Moreno in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
 DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
